alert.note: Alert for Boone (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 3:26PM CDT until May 12 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Nebraska, including the following county, Boone. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 326 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Edward, Cedar Rapids and The Highway 14 And 56 Junction. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
